channel.title: OnOptions
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from OnOptions, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: The Business Plan for Raising Cane’s Earned its Founder the Worst Grade In His Class. But it Had 1 Genius Insight That Made Him a Billionaire
Bari Weiss wants to save America. First, she’ll have to save CBS News
item.description: She built her power by opposing the media elite on a website bankrolled by anti-woke tech billionaires. Now she's running one of America's biggest new...

item.title: Want to foster psychological safety? Start by looking in the mirror
item.description: More than two decades of research—from Harvard professor Amy Edmondson’s pioneering studies to Google’s landmark Project Aristotle—have found that the...

item.title: How a merch fiasco became a brand win for Starbucks
item.description: It’s not often that headlines about customer “brawls” end up morphing into good news for a brand. But that’s arguably what’s happened to Starbucks tha...

item.title: Today’s corporate boards look like the past: older directors, more male appointees, and less turnover
item.description: Also: All the news and watercooler chat from Fortune.

item.title: Why Bitcoin Could Soar After Months of Sideways Trading
item.description: Wall Street still sees as high as a $170,000 price target in 2026.

item.title: Why entry-level workers are more hopeful than their bosses right now

item.title: A meeting with the Governor’s Office and an altered public document: How Elon Musk’s Boring Company got three safety violations rescinded in 24 hours
item.description: Lawyers and regulators say the Nevada state agency’s handling of the safety investigation went against procedure.

item.title: Visa leans into AI-enabled payments and stablecoins to stay ahead of the game in Asia
item.description: One thing missing from current chatbots is "the ability to make payment via an agent,” said Asia-Pacific president Stephen Karpin.

item.title: Sonos’s CEO Keeps Responding to Angry Customers on Threads. It’s a Lesson for Every Leader
item.description: Tom Conrad knows that fixing the customer relationship is as important as fixing the software.

item.title: Claude on campus: How Anthropic is building a user base by launching AI clubs
item.description: With over 800 student organizations on campus, the University of Pennsylvania already seems to have a club for every interest, from investment banking...

item.title: An AI Tool Withheld an Employee’s Paycheck. That’s Really a Human Error
item.description: AI automates plenty of repetitive tasks, like running payroll, but you need a human to check its work.

item.title: The U.S. aims to breathe easy amid China’s chokehold on rare earths, but loosening the grip takes years of concerted effort
item.description: U.S. races to establish rare earths supply chains domestically and abroad in "Cold War 2.0."

item.title: My New Employee Is Someone I Fired at My Last Company
item.description: … and two other tricky workplace dilemmas.
